"We spent four years in a circle of ****, we suffered unspeakably and it ruined our lives," Sollecito, whose journey mirrored Knox's minus the morbid celebrity status she was awarded on day one, told Oggi magazine in October 2011 upon their release from prison on appeal.At the time, Knox's father, Curt Knox, said that his daughter was adjusting well to being back home—since her return to the States weeks earlier, she had been photographed with her old college friend Madison Paxton and going for a drive with stepfather Chris Mellas, but still mostly stayed inside, for her safety and to avoid the media. They had received hate mail and threatening phone calls at the house, Curt told the Daily Mail, and Knox went places with a bodyguard.It would've been easy to understand if Knox also considered her life to be ruined. She would forever be linked to a terrible crime, no matter...
